sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of (A △ B) △ B and A △ (B △ B), where △ represents the symmetric difference of sets. Show that the two results are not equal, thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
